    Mirasys Development Environment Setup

    1. Overview

    This document provides step-by-step instructions for setting up the Mirasys application in a local development environment on Ubuntu using Docker.

    2. System Requirements

    Requirement Details
    Operating System Ubuntu 20.04.6 LTS x86_64
    Docker Must be installed
    User Permissions Sudo (administrator) privileges required
    Internet Access Required to download images and packages

    3. Check System Requirements

    To check if your system meets the requirements, run the following commands:

    grep -o -w 'sse3\|ssse3\|sse4_1\|sse4_2\|popcnt\|cx16\|lahf_lm' /proc/cpuinfo | sort | uniq
    ðŸŸ¢ Output example if compatible: 
    cx16
lahf_lm
popcnt
sse4_1
sse4_2
ssse3

    4. Docker Installation (Ubuntu)

    To install Docker, run the following commands:

    sudo apt update && sudo apt install apt-transport-https ca-certificates curl software-properties-common

    curl -fsSL https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu/gpg | sudo gpg --dearmor -o /usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg

    echo "deb [arch=amd64 signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/docker-archive-keyring.gpg] \
https://download.docker.com/linux/ubuntu $(lsb_release -cs) stable" | \
sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/docker.list > /dev/null

    sudo apt update && sudo apt install docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io && sudo groupadd docker && sudo usermod -aG docker $USER

    Note: Log out and log back in to apply group changes.

    To verify Docker installation:

    sudo systemctl status docker

    5. Application Setup

    Clone the Mirasys repository using one of the following commands:

    # Clone with specific branch
git clone <YOUR_GIT_REPOSITORY_LINK> -b <BRANCH_NAME>

# Clone default branch
git clone <YOUR_GIT_REPOSITORY_LINK>

    6. Permission Setup

    After cloning the repository, navigate to the project directory and set the necessary permissions:

    chmod +x mirasys.setup.sh && \
chmod +x setupScript/*.sh && \
chmod +x troubleshoot-system/*.sh
